page.title: 14DAILY LIFE IN SALISBURY
page.content: My working day begins with the alarm going off at 6.30am. I crawl out of bed, go downstairs to put on the kettle and radio. Usually I finish washing and shaving by 7.00am, then have my breakfast and sit in the armchair for ten minutes. After a cup of tea I prepare for work and leave home at 7.50am. I go to work at Woodrow's on the nearby Industrial Estate by bicyle or car; I arrive by 8.00am. I have a quarter hour break at 10.30am, go home for dinner from 1 pm till 2.00pm and finish work at 5.00pm. After tea I generally watch the news on T.V and occasionally "nod off" for a few minutes. Before going out for a run I do any jobs round the house or on the car. Running helps me to relax after the pressures of a working day. I usually watch a T.V. film or a video. My day ends at 11.30 pm.
